Package project.graph

Class Graph<T>

java.lang.Object
project.graph.Graph<T>
Type Parameters:
T - The label's type of the vertices
Direct Known Subclasses:
PirateGraph
public class Graph<T>
extends java.lang.Object
This class represents a graph with a list of vertices and edges.
Since:
2.0
Version:
1.0
Author:
EL MONTASER Osmane, EL MONTASER Osmane

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Graph()
    Initializes the lists of vertices and edges.

  • Constructor Details

    • Graph

      public Graph()
      Initializes the lists of vertices and edges.

  • Method Details

    • addVertex

      public void addVertex​(Vertex<T> v)
      Adds a vertex in the graph.
      Parameters:
      v - Vertex T to add.

    • addEdge

      public void addEdge​(int v1, int v2, double weight) throws EdgeDuplicateException, java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Adds an edge between a vertex at index v1 and a vertex at index v2 with a given weight. No edge duplicates allowed.
      Parameters:
      v1 - First index of the first vertex.
      v2 - Second index of the second vertex.
      weight - The weight of the said vertex.
      Throws:
      EdgeDuplicateException - If the edge already exists in the graph.
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If one or two of the vertices doesn't exist in the graph.

    • addEdge

      public void addEdge​(int v1, int v2) throws EdgeDuplicateException, java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Adds an edge between a vertex at index v1 and a vertex at index v2. The weight of the edge will be automatically set to 0. No edge duplicates allowed.
      Parameters:
      v1 - First index of the first vertex.
      v2 - Second index of the second vertex.
      Throws:
      EdgeDuplicateException - If the edge already exists in the graph.
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If one or two of the vertices doesn't exist in the graph.

    • isVertexExists

      public boolean isVertexExists​(Vertex<T> v)
      Know if a given vertex exists in the graph.
      Parameters:
      v - The vertex to find.
      Returns:
      True if the vertex exists, False otherwise.

    • isEdgeExists

      public boolean isEdgeExists​(Vertex<T> v1, Vertex<T> v2) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Know if there is an edge between 2 vertices.
      Parameters:
      v1 - First vertex.
      v2 - Second vertex.
      Returns:
      True if there is an edge, False otherwise.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If one of the given vertices doesn't exist in the graph.

    • getEdge

      public Edge<T> getEdge​(Vertex<T> v1, Vertex<T> v2) throws EdgeNotFoundException
      Get the edge by giving its 2 vertices.
      Parameters:
      v1 - First Vertex.
      v2 - Second Vertex.
      Returns:
      The edge between v1 and v2 if it exists.
      Throws:
      EdgeNotFoundException - If the edge doesn't exist in the graph.

    • getVertex

      public Vertex<T> getVertex​(int i) throws VertexNotFoundException
      Get a vertex of the graph.
      Parameters:
      i - The index of the vertex to find.
      Returns:
      The vertex which you want to get.
      Throws:
      VertexNotFoundException - If the vertex was not found in the graph.
